title.rendered: How to Tell if You Have an Overgrowth of Candida?

content.rendered:
How to Tell if You Have an Overgrowth of Candida?

DO YOU HAVE A

CANDIDA OVERGROWTH?

Candida is a type of fungus, which is a form of yeast, that can be found in the mouth and intestinal tract. The problems occur when candida is overproduced.

Learn More!

One symptom is Oral Thrush which includes symptoms like a white tongue or bad breath.

Learn More!

Candida can cause vaginal yeast infections as well as Athlete’s Foot and fungus in the toenails.

Learn More!

If you suffer from chronic fatigue or exhaustion despite getting enough rest every night, it may be a sign that you have candida.

Learn More!

An overgrowth of candida can be an underlying cause of chronic allergies.

Learn More!

Candida can cause urinary tract infections and other vaginal infections and issues in women.

Learn More!

With the right steps, you can cure yourself of these awful symptoms and treat candida overgrowth in the body.
Swipe up to learn how to get rid of candida overgrowth.

Swipe Up!

excerpt.rendered: What is Candida and how can you tell if you have an overgrowth. Learn what the symptoms are! 1. Oral Thrush 2. Fungal Infection 3. Fatigue 4. Urinary Tract Infection 5. Chronic Allergies
